info.title: TPConnects Combined API Gateway version
info.description: This API allows shopping and booking with IATA's New Distribution Capabilities (NDC) standard. It provides aggregated shopping capabilities (AirShopping), detailed offer description (OfferPrice), flight seat selection (SeatAvailability) and booking flight reservations (OrderCreate). Some fields in our API (when noticed) use the PADIS Standard v18.2. Find more information

OptionalChargesCode.description: Allowance catalog requested.  Example: C (Catalog Only).

Multiple Offers can be requested at the same time, each of which could originate from different shopping responses (each with their own ResponseIDs). Each Offer selected could reference (via the OfferID) either standard Offers from an AirShoppingRS message (potentially with Flight-related services) or A-La-Carte Offers (containing optional ancillary services). These standard Offers and Ã¢â‚¬Å“a-la-carteÃ¢â‚¬Â Offers would need to be consistent with the applicability rules defined by their relations (passengers or segments eligible for the enclosed OfferItems) and would be combined to produce a single Order, returned by the OrderViewRS message.

EmailAddressText.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

LabelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact.  Examples: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination

CreditCardIssuerCode.description: The CC Issuer code in case FOID is a Credit Card.

FOIDTypeText.description: Form of identification type code used for booking/ticketing.  Examples: PP (passport), CC (credit card), FF (frequent flyer), DL (drivers license)

AddlInfoText.description: The fare calculation text required in the fare calculation area of an electronic ticket.

PricingCodeText.description: Primary identifier reflecting the method of pricing for a transaction.

ReportingCodeText.description: Secondary identifier reflecting the method of pricing for a transaction used in the reporting process.

CabinType.description: Type of compartment of an aircraft, offering specific services (e.g. business class, economy).

FareBasisAppCode.description: Indicates how the fare basis was applied.  E.g. Requested, Ticketed, Other.

FareBasisCityPairText.description: Identified published fare.  Origin and destination city codes and two character designator of fare owning airline associated with Fare Basis Code.  Example: MIANCEDL

FareRule.description: Special purchasing rules and restrictions used to differentiate fare levels from one another.

FareTypeCode.description: Fare Amount Type Code, ex: ADC (Additional Charge), IT (Tour Inclusive), NOADC (No additional charge).

PaxSegmentRefID.description: References a Passenger Segment ID within this message.

Price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

PriceClassRefID.description: A price point within a particular Cabin Type (sometimes referred to as 'Fare Families').

RBD.description: Reservation Booking Designator.  A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. Identified using a single alpha character. E.g. 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Disc

AccountCode.description: Corporate ID used for pricing special fares.  Example: 675124

FareCalculationInfo.description: Information related to the calculation of the Fare amount by applying various rules to determine a final fare for an airline ticket.

FareComponent.description: A portion of an itinerary between two consecutive fare construction points.  If the journey has only one fare component, the points of origin and destination are the only fare construction points

FareIndCode.description: Fare indicator code.  Example: 1 (SYSTEM PRICED WITHOUT MANUAL INTERVENTION)  Encoding Scheme: IATA PADIS Code List for data element 5387 - Price Type Qualifier

FarePriceType.description: The type of fair price applied to a Fare Detail (e.g. filed amount, net amount, or a sell amount).

FareWaiver.description: Validating carrier-assigned fare rule modification or override information.

FiledFareInd.description: When TRUE, a component of this fare has been priced using filed fare data.  If FALSE, dynamic pricing has been applied.

NetReportingCodeText.description: Code indicating if the transaction is subject to a net reporting arrangement.

PaxRefID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

PricingSystemCodeText.description: IATA assigned code identifying the system used to price the itinerary for the document being issued.

StatisticalCodeText.description: Code used for domestic or international sales differentiation.

FareGroup.description: Fare Type Code. Examples: 70J, Published Fares 70K, Dynamic Discounted Fares 749, Negotiated Fares 756, One Way Fare 758, Private Fares Encoding Scheme: PADIS codeset element 9910 - Fare Qualifier

FareCode.description: Fare Type Code. Examples: 70J, Published Fares 70K, Dynamic Discounted Fares 749, Negotiated Fares 756, One Way Fare 58, Private Fares Encoding Scheme: PADIS codeset element 9910 - Fare Qualifier

FareDetail.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

FareGroupID.description: Unique identifier for this Fare Group.

FarePriceTypeCode.description: Indicates if the fare price provided is a filed amount, net amount, or a sell amount.

Price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

InstantPurchaseTypeCode.description: Instant purchase type code, Ex: CC (Ticketless purchase immediately charged to credit card) NO (Not an instant purchase) TT (Simultaneous with time of ticketing)  Encoding scheme: IATA PADIS Codeset IPT - Instant Purchase Type

Penalty.description: Information related to a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

RuleCode.description: Fare category number as defined by ATPCO.

TicketlessInd.description: When TRUE, there are no ticket records, as defined by IATA Resolutions, expected to be issued for this segment.

FareRuleWaiverCode.description: Code assigned by the validating carrier that allows fare rule modification or override.

FareWaiverTypeCode.description: Waiver type code.  Examples: ExchangeReissued, FareComponent.

ApproximateInd.description: When true, this tax amount is approximate.

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

LocalAmount.description: Fee amount specified in a local currency. Example: 7 CHF

RefundInd.description: When true, this tax is refundable.

MandatoryInd.description: When TRUE, indicates the associated field is expected to be populated.

PathText.description: Message property location using XPATH syntax.

FareDetail.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

OriginDestRefID.description: Reference to an Origin Destination within this message.

Price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

NaturalAreaGeocode.description: Natural Area Geocode as defined by NAC Geographic Products Inc.  Ex: 8KDB PGFD

PointElevationNumber.description: The number of the spatial location point elevation.

PointLatitudeNumber.description: The number of the spatial location point latitude.

PointLongitudeNumber.description: The number of the spatial location point longitude.

IATAAircraftTypeCode.description: Code assigned to an aircraft type in IATA SSIM.

Party.description: NDC Message/ Transaction Party(s) information.  Note that information about parties is intended for business use, it is not intended for transaction authentication and routing of the message.

AltLangID.description: Identifies the alternate language for a customer or message. The human language is identified by ISO 639 codes.

CorrelationID.description: Allow end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

EchoTokenText.description: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

PrimaryLangID.description: Identifes the primary language preference for the message.  The human language is identified by ISO 639 codes.

RetransmissionInd.description: When true, indicates the message is being re-sent after a failure. It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to true) only when a message is retransmitted.

SeqNumber.description: Used to identify the sequence number of the transaction as assigned by the sending system; allows for an application to process messages in a certain order or to request a resynchronization of messages in the event that a system has been off-line and nee

TrxID.description: Globally unique ID for a transaction processing instance.

TrxStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

Birthdate.description: The Date of Birth of the Passenger.  Intended to be used in NDC Anonymous Shopping requests. Example: 2017-01-13

BirthplaceText.description: Country Code where the Passenger was born (ISO 3166).  For example: DE

CitizenshipCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

ExpiryDate.description: The date the identity document expires.

GenderCode.description: Gender of the individual (M, F, or X for unspecified).

GivenName.description: A personal name given to the individual at birthÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â and used before aÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â family name. Also called first name. E.g. JOHN.

IdentityDocID.description: Uniquely identifies the document from all other identity documents issued by the state or organization. e.g. passport number, drivers license number.

IdentityDocTypeCode.description: The type of passenger document.  Examples: PT (Passport)

IssueDate.description: The date the identity document was issued.

IssuingCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

MiddleName.description: Individual's middle name or initial.  E.g. G, GEORGE.

ResidenceCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

SuffixName.description: Individual's name suffixes and letters. Examples: Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.

Visa.description: An official entry in a Passport or other Travel Document made by an official of a government to indicate that the bearer has been granted authority to enter or re-enter the country or region concerned.

KeyText.description: Name or ID of the Keyword.

ValueText.description: Value corresponding to the associated Keyword.

LangCode.description: Language Code representation.

Individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

LoyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

PTC.description: Type code applying to the Passenger which typically drives pricing (e.g. ADT, CHD, etc).

PaxID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

PaxRefID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

For American Express,  4 digits located on the front of the card, above the card number on the right hand side. Visa - CVV2, MasterCard - CVC2, American Express - CID, Discover - CMID, Union Pay - CVN2, JCB - CAV2.

Merchant.description: A person or company that sells goods or services.

UpgradeFeeInd.description: When TRUE, Upgrade fee(s) may apply.

SeqNumber.description: Used to identify the sequence number of the transaction as assigned by the sending system; allows for an application to process messages in a certain order or to request a resynchronization of messages in the event that a system has been off-line and nee

Timestamp.description: Indicates the creation date and time of the message in UTC.

TrxID.description: A unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

TrxStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

VersionNumber.description: For all IATA versioned messages, the version of the message is indicated by a decimal value.

Birthdate.description: The date on which an individual was born.

BirthplaceText.description: Country Code where the Passenger was born (ISO 3166).  For example: DE

GenderCode.description: Gender of the individual (M, F, or X for unspecified).

GivenName.description: A personal name given to the individual at birthÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â and used before aÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â family name. Also called first name. E.g. JOHN.

IndividualID.description: Uniquely Identifies an Individual within the context of one message.

MiddleName.description: Individual's middle name or initial.  E.g. G, GEORGE.

SuffixName.description: Individual's name suffixes and letters. Examples: Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.

Surname.description: Individual's hereditaryÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â name(s) common to all members of a family. Also known as family name or last name. E.g. SMITH. Excludes any potential suffix.

TitleName.description: A word such as Mr., Mrs., Miss or Dr that is used before an individual's name to indicate the gender, profession or marital status.

KeyText.description: Name or ID of the Keyword.

ValueText.description: Value corresponding to the associated Keyword.

OrderID.description: Carrier assigned ID which uniquely identifies a specific Order across several messages.

OwnerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

OwnerTypeCode.description: Indicates whether the owner is the ORA or POA.

WebAddressURI.description: Deep linking into another site to complete the transaction. E.g. to bring the customer directly to a page to continue with a purchase of a specific offer.

LabelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact.  Examples: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination

OtherAddressText.description: Other Contact Method Value. Example: www.marketingsite.com

Aggregator.description: An entity who distributes a Seller's shopping request to multiple Airlines and aggregates subsequent responses.

Corporation.description: A company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law.

MarketingCarrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

ORA.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

CardHolderName.description: Name of credit card holder. Example: JOHN SMITH

CardNumber.description: The card number indicated on the payment card.

For American Express,  4 digits located on the front of the card, above the card number on the right hand side. Visa - CVV2, MasterCard - CVC2, American Express - CID, Discover - CMID, Union Pay - CVN2, JCB - CAV2.

LabelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact.  Examples: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination

Country.description: A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

Device.description: Device upon which the secure transaction will occur.

PricingCodeText.description: Primary identifier reflecting the method of pricing for a transaction.

ReportingCodeText.description: Secondary identifier reflecting the method of pricing for a transaction used in the reporting process.

CabinType.description: Type of compartment of an aircraft, offering specific services (e.g. business class, economy).

FareBasisAppCode.description: Indicates how the fare basis was applied.  E.g. Requested, Ticketed, Other.

FareBasisCityPairText.description: Identified published fare.  Origin and destination city codes and two character designator of fare owning airline associated with Fare Basis Code.  Example: MIANCEDL

FareRule.description: Special purchasing rules and restrictions used to differentiate fare levels from one another.

FareTypeCode.description: Fare Amount Type Code, ex: ADC (Additional Charge), IT (Tour Inclusive), NOADC (No additional charge).

PaxSegment.description: Transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment.

Price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

PriceClass.description: A price point within a particular Cabin Type (sometimes referred to as 'Fare Families').

RBD.description: Reservation Booking Designator.  A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. Identified using a single alpha character. E.g. 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Disc

AccountCode.description: Corporate ID used for pricing special fares.  Example: 675124

FareCalculationInfo.description: Information related to the calculation of the Fare amount by applying various rules to determine a final fare for an airline ticket.

FareComponent.description: A portion of an itinerary between two consecutive fare construction points.  If the journey has only one fare component, the points of origin and destination are the only fare construction points

FareIndCode.description: Fare indicator code.  Example: 1 (SYSTEM PRICED WITHOUT MANUAL INTERVENTION)  Encoding Scheme: IATA PADIS Code List for data element 5387 - Price Type Qualifier

FarePriceType.description: The type of fair price applied to a Fare Detail (e.g. filed amount, net amount, or a sell amount).

FareWaiver.description: Validating carrier-assigned fare rule modification or override information.

FiledFareInd.description: When TRUE, a component of this fare has been priced using filed fare data.  If FALSE, dynamic pricing has been applied.

NetReportingCodeText.description: Code indicating if the transaction is subject to a net reporting arrangement.

PricingSystemCodeText.description: IATA assigned code identifying the system used to price the itinerary for the document being issued.

StatisticalCodeText.description: Code used for domestic or international sales differentiation.

FarePriceTypeCode.description: Indicates if the fare price provided is a filed amount, net amount, or a sell amount.

Price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

InstantPurchaseTypeCode.description: Instant purchase type code, Ex: CC (Ticketless purchase immediately charged to credit card) NO (Not an instant purchase) TT (Simultaneous with time of ticketing)  Encoding scheme: IATA PADIS Codeset IPT - Instant Purchase Type

Penalty.description: Information related to a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

RuleCode.description: Fare category number as defined by ATPCO.

TicketlessInd.description: When TRUE, there are no ticket records, as defined by IATA Resolutions, expected to be issued for this segment.

FareRuleWaiverCode.description: Code assigned by the validating carrier that allows fare rule modification or override.

FareWaiverTypeCode.description: Waiver type code.  Examples: ExchangeReissued, FareComponent.

ApproximateInd.description: When true, this tax amount is approximate.

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

LocalAmount.description: Fee amount specified in a local currency. Example: 7 CHF

RefundInd.description: When true, this tax is refundable.

BankersSellerRate.description: The BSR or BBR used to convert the filed fee amount from the filed currency into the currency of payment.

AssociatedObjectID.description: Identifier of the object intended to be associated within this message. E.g. PAX001

AssociatedObjectName.description: Name of the object intended to be associated. E.g. Passenger

AssociatedObjectPath.description: XPath to the object intended to be associated within this message.

IATAAircraftTypeCode.description: Code assigned to an aircraft type in IATA SSIM.

Error.description: Error(s) that prevented message from processing.

AltLangID.description: Identifies the alternate language for a customer or message. The human language is identified by ISO 639 codes.

CorrelationID.description: Allow end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

EchoTokenText.description: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

PrimaryLangID.description: Identifes the primary language preference for the message.  The human language is identified by ISO 639 codes.

RetransmissionInd.description: When true, indicates the message is being re-sent after a failure. It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to true) only when a message is retransmitted.

SeqNumber.description: Used to identify the sequence number of the transaction as assigned by the sending system; allows for an application to process messages in a certain order or to request a resynchronization of messages in the event that a system has been off-line and nee

TrxID.description: A unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

TrxStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

VersionNumber.description: For all IATA versioned messages, the version of the message is indicated by a decimal value.

Birthdate.description: The date on which an individual was born.

BirthplaceText.description: Country Code where the Passenger was born (ISO 3166).  For example: DE

GenderCode.description: Gender of the individual (M, F, or X for unspecified).

GivenName.description: A personal name given to the individual at birthÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â and used before aÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â family name. Also called first name. E.g. JOHN.

IndividualID.description: Uniquely Identifies an Individual within the context of one message.

MiddleName.description: Individual's middle name or initial.  E.g. G, GEORGE.

SuffixName.description: Individual's name suffixes and letters. Examples: Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.

Surname.description: Individual's hereditaryÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â name(s) common to all members of a family. Also known as family name or last name. E.g. SMITH. Excludes any potential suffix.

TitleName.description: A word such as Mr., Mrs., Miss or Dr that is used before an individual's name to indicate the gender, profession or marital status.

MethodCode.description: Settlement method. Examples: - AD (Internal Airline Document) - DS (Direct Settlement) - EA (EMD Associated or Internal Airline Document).

SettlementAmount.description: Settlement (Price) Value. Example: 300 (USD) Note: This represents a Settlement value that is only used between the POA and ORA.

TaxableInd.description: In some markets, commission is VAT-able (i.e. Taxable)

KeyText.description: Name or ID of the Keyword.

ValueText.description: Value corresponding to the associated Keyword.

AccountNumber.description: Loyalty Program account number. Example: ABC123456

Carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

LoyaltyProgram.description: A rewards program offered by a company to customers who frequently make purchases, which may give a customer advanced access to new products, special sales coupons or free merchandise.

ProgramName.description: Loyalty Program Name. Example: Miles and More

ProviderName.description: Name of the organization providing the Loyalty Program.

TierPriorityText.description: Loyalty Program account priority within the tier (e.g. Platinum, executive, etc.)

URL.description: Link to an online description of the provided warning.

Carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

ProgramName.description: Loyalty Program Name. Example: Miles and More

ProviderName.description: Name of the organization providing the Loyalty Program.

URL.description: Link to an online description of the provided warning.

LoyaltyCurAmount.description: The quantity of loyalty units redeemed. Example: 15000

LoyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

Associations.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

BinaryObject.description: Binary Object Information.  Supplementary attributes include character set code, MIME code, encoding information, file name, format, and URI

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

FileSizeMeasure.description: The size of the Attachment in kilobytes (KB). Example: 60

HeightMeasure.description: Media (typically Image) height in specified units.

HintText.description: Media object tip which is typically used in a client GUI (a mouseover tip). Example: Envoy Class Seat

MediaID.description: Uniquely Identifies a Media file within the context of one message.

RenderingInstructionsText.description: Rendering Instruction Parameters. Notes: This is typically used for XSLT.

RenderingMethodText.description: Rendering Method name.  E.g. Narrative, XSLT, etc.

RenderingOutputFormatText.description: An identifier for a file format or content type of the rendered output.

RenderingOverviewText.description: An overview of the rendering method or style.

WidthMeasure.description: Media (typically Image) width in specified units.

OrderItemRefID.description: Carrier assigned ID which uniquely identifies a specific Order Item across several messages.

OrderRefID.description: References the canceled Order's Order ID.

OwnerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

OwnerTypeCode.description: Indicates whether the owner is the ORA or POA.

ServiceRefID.description: Service ID assigned by the carrier.

WebAddressURI.description: Deep linking into another site to complete the transaction. E.g. to bring the customer directly to a page to continue with a purchase of a specific offer.

ContactInfo.description: The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email, contact postal address, contact phone number.

DestCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

OriginCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

OriginDestID.description: Uniquely identifies an Origin Destination within the context of one message.

PaxJourneyRefID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Journey within the context of one message.

LabelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact.  Examples: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination

OtherAddressText.description: Other Contact Method Value. Example: www.marketingsite.com

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

ARNKInd.description: When TRUE, indicates an ARNK (ARrival uNKown) condition, i.e. a gap between current segment departure and previous segment arrival location, implying an unknown passenger movement.

Arrival.description: The action or process of arriving of a transport vehicle in any place or location.

CabinType.description: Type of compartment of an aircraft, offering specific services (e.g. business class, economy).

DatedOperatingLeg.description: The nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

Dep.description: The action or process of leaving of a transport vehicle from any place or location.

Duration.description: Total segment time including the combined air time and connection times of any legs.

InterlineSettlementInfo.description: Information related to the value of a product or service as it pertains to interline transactions.

MarketingCarrierInfo.description: The commercial designation under which a Dated Operating Segment can be booked, either under the operating carrier's designator or that of another carrier (codeshare).

MarketingCarrierRBD.description: Reservation Booking Designator.  A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. Identified using a single alpha character. E.g. 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Disc

OperatingCarrierInfo.description: An operation between board point and any subsequent off point within the same flight designator. Could be one or more legs. Could also be used for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

OperatingCarrierRBD.description: Reservation Booking Designator.  A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. Identified using a single alpha character. E.g. 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Disc

PaxSegmentID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Segment within the context of one message.

SecureFlightInd.description: When TRUE, this segment is subject to US TSA 'Secure Flight' passenger prescreening program.

SegmentTypeCode.description: Defines the operational flight segment type (e.g. Open, Passive, Service).  Encoding Scheme: IATA PADIS 1.4 Codeset FST - Flight Segment Type

TicketlessInd.description: When TRUE, there are no ticket records, as defined by IATA Resolutions, expected to be issued for this segment.

CardBrandCode.description: A two-letter code assigned according to IATA Resolution 728. Example: VI for Visa

CardHolderName.description: Name of credit card holder. Example: JOHN SMITH

CardNumber.description: The card number indicated on the payment card.

CardProductTypeCode.description: Used to specify whether the card is a Consumer (personal) or Commercial (corporate) card.

CardSecurityCode.description: 3-digit number printed on the signature panel on the back of the card and following the last four digits of the Primary Account Number (PAN). For American Express,  4 digits located on the front of the card, above the card number on the right hand side. Visa - CVV2, MasterCard - CVC2, American Express - CID, Discover - CMID, Union Pay - CVN2, JCB - CAV2.

CardSeqNumber.description: Number displayed on a payment card following the card number which indicates if the card is an original or if it was re-issued with the same card number.

CardTypeText.description: Additional description for the magnetic stripe card type (debit card, credit card, prepaid card, etc.)

ProtectedCardID.description: Payment card number protected in a non format preserving fashion.

ReconciliationID.description: Identifies the individual for this specific transaction when the card is shared (for example, corporate card).  This ID is typically used for payment reconciliation.

SellerOwnCardInd.description: When TRUE, indicates the seller is using their own card.  If FALSE, customer card is being used.

ContactInfoRefID.description: Reference to the Payer's Contact ID within this message.

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

PaymentInfoID.description: Uniquely identifies payment information within a message.

PaymentInfoRefID.description: If creating the order after payment authorization it is a way of linking an order to an existing payment reference. not triggering the whole process again.

PaymentMethod.description: A form of procedure for the payment of goods or services, plus any transactional information specific to the payment method other than the amount.

PaymentStatusCode.description: Indicates the current status of this payment information.

PriceVarianceAmount.description: Price variance amount applied during Payment processing.

PriceVarianceRule.description: Price Variance supports specifying Payment Processing Rules, including payment failure. Acceptable amount and/or percentage of the total amount by which the Order item price can vary. Example: 20 USD, 2 Percent

Promotion.description: Information related to publicizing  a product, organization, or venture so as to increase sales or public awareness.

SurchargeAmount.description: Amount added to the final Offer/Order price, depending on which payment method is used by the client.

TypeCode.description: Uses a bilaterally agreed set of values to indicate the warning type.  The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has not been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type = 'unknown'.

VerificationInd.description: When true, this payment requires additional authentication.

AccountableDoc.description: Form of payment which utilizes a previously issued accountable travel document (ticket, EMD, coupon, etc.) which has an outstanding credit value.

BankTransfer.description: Bank Account payment method definition. Customer bank accounts for payments, either for paper checks or electronic funds transfer.

Cash.description: Any payment that is collected by the agent and settled between the Airline and the agent. Refer to IATA Resolution 728 Attachment A for full details.

Check.description: A written order instructing a financial institution to pay immediately on demand a specified amount of money from the check writer's account to the person named on the check or, if a specific person is not named, to whoever bears the check to the institu

DirectBill.description: System in which a corporation's travel agency bills employees for their business travel. The employee must then submit an expense accounting and be reimbursed by the corporation.

LoyaltyRedemption.description: A form of payment by which the customer uses a virtual currency of a Loyalty Program Account (such as air miles) in exchange for goods or services.

OtherPaymentMethod.description: Information relating to non-standard forms of payment which may be used in exchange for goods or services.

PaymentCard.description: A device that enables its owner (the cardholder) to make a payment by electronic funds transfer.

Voucher.description: A document that entitles the holder to a discount or that may be exchanged for goods or services.

AppCode.description: Penalty application type. Examples: ADE (After departure) NOS (No show) PDE (Prior to departure)

CancelFeeInd.description: When TRUE, Cancellation fee(s) may apply.

ChangeFeeInd.description: When TRUE, Change of Itinerary fee(s) may apply.

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

PenaltyAmount.description: Penalty monetary value amount and currency code.

PenaltyPercent.description: Percentage Value relating to acceptable the total amount by which the Order item price can vary; OR the amount of a penalty.  Example: 20 USD, 2 Percent

TypeCode.description: Uses a bilaterally agreed set of values to indicate the warning type.  The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has not been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type = 'unknown'.

UpgradeFeeInd.description: When TRUE, Upgrade fee(s) may apply.

CountryDialingCode.description: Numeric telephone dialingÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â prefixes for the memberÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â countries of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU).

LabelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact.  Examples: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination

PhoneNumber.description: Phone number text. Examples: +1 999-999-9999 ext 1234,  617-9976 Note: This may be a simple, un-structured phone number, such as +01 999-999-9999 ext 1234 or combined with the additional attributes to create a structured phone number.

ApplicableBagText.description: Applicable bag type.  Examples: Carry-On, 1st Checked Bag, 2nd Checked Bag

ApplicablePartyText.description: Baggage weight restriction application.  Examples: Party, Traveler. Party applies to all Travelers.

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

PieceDimensionAllowance.description: Baggage dimension allowance with application information.

PieceWeightAllowance.description: Baggage weight allowance with application information.

TotalQty.description: Maximum pieces of baggage allowed. Example: 4

TypeText.description: Type of bag. Example: Golf Equipment, Fishing Bag, Car Seat, etc.

BuildingRoomText.description: Additional address information including building name, room, apartment, or suite number.

CityName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the city, town or village.

CountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

CountryName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the country.

CountrySubDivisionName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the sub-division of a country.

LabelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact.  Examples: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination

POBoxCode.description: Post office box.  Example: P.O. Box 21

StreetText.description: Street name and number. Examples: Main Street, 100 Main Street

CabinType.description: Type of compartment of an aircraft, offering specific services (e.g. business class, economy).

Code.description: The code corresponding to the processing warning as defined by PADIS 9321.

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

DisplayOrderText.description: The Airline requested default display order (in a client application) for this price class.  For example: 2.

FareBasisAppText.description: Fare basis application.  Examples: Requested, Ticketed, Other.

PriceClassID.description: Uniquely Identifies a Price Class within the context of one message.

CurConversion.description: The result of converting one currency into another currency. E.g. local currency to USD, air miles to monetary.

Discount.description: Deduction from the price amount, made in advance of its payment.

EquivAmount.description: The entire amount of transaction stated in the local currency at the point of sale, or the currency as defined by the Currency Indicator Code.

Fee.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

LoyaltyUnitAmount.description: Amount specified in loyalty units.  Note: the 'Currency Code' sup for this BDT should not be populated.

LoyaltyUnitName.description: The name of the loyalty unit used by the loyalty unit amount (e.g. miles or points).

Surcharge.description: Amount added on to a usual charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

TaxSummary.description: The sum of all tax amounts applied on a given price.

AcceptableVarianceAmount.description: Acceptable amount by which the price at time of payment can vary. Example: 20 USD

AcceptableVariancePercent.description: Acceptable percent by which the price at time of payment can vary. Example: 2 percent

OwnerName.description: The name of the organization owning the warning codelist.

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

RuleID.description: Rule ID assigned by the owner. Example: PRICERULE001.

RuleName.description: Rule Name. Example: Acceptable Price variance

Carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

Org.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

TravelAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

OwnerName.description: The name of the organization owning the warning codelist.

PromotionID.description: Promotion code ID or number. Example: PROMO123. Used in conjunction with Link (Promotion URL), Issuer (Promotion Owner or Sponsor) and Remarks (Promotion remarks).

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

URL.description: Link to an online description of the provided warning.

RBDCode.description: Code used to identify a particular RBD (e.g. P, J, W, M, etc.).

DisplayInd.description: When TRUE, this remark should be displayed.  Notes: 1. This capability may not be supported by all NDC-enabled systems or may be supported by bilateral agreement only.  The technical implementation of this capability is not dictated by this specificat

RemarkText.description: Free text to provide further information related to the document.

PaxSegment.description: Transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment.

ResStatusCode.description: This field contains the Reservation Status Code of the Reservation Change flight.

MarketingMessage.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

ChangeFees.description: Information related to a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.

OrderCancelProcessing.description: Information related to how response results should be returned.

OrderRefID.description: References the canceled Order's Order ID.

TicketDocInfo.description: Information corresponding to a group of 1 to 4 Tickets for a single Origin Destination and a single Passenger.

Warning.description: Contains information related to potential business errors detected during processing of the preceding request.

IATALocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

StationName.description: Name of the station. E.g. George Bush Intercontinental Airport

AllRefundableInd.description: When true, all tax breakdown amounts are refundable.

Breakdown.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

AllRefundableInd.description: When true, all tax breakdown amounts are refundable.

ApproximateInd.description: When true, this tax amount is approximate.

CollectionInd.description: When true, this tax must be collected.

Tax.description: A compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits or added to the cost of some goods, services, and transactions.

TotalTaxAmount.description: Total of all applicable tax amounts included in the price.  If tax breakdowns are provided, this amount should match the sum of the tax breakdown amounts.

AddlFiledTaxCode.description: A qualifier to the Tax Code to distinguish taxes/fees/charges with the same tax code but with different business uses.

AddlTaxCode.description: A qualifier to the Tax Code to distinguish taxes/fees/charges with the same tax code but with different business uses.

AppTypeCode.description: Indicates at which point the tax was applied (e.g. S - Sale, D - Departure, A - Arrival, X - Delivery).

ApproximateInd.description: When true, this tax amount is approximate.

CollectionInd.description: When true, this tax must be collected.

CollectionPointTax.description: Tax data breakdown by collection point for XF(Passenger Facility Fee) and ZP(federal tax segment) taxes.

Country.description: A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

CountrySubDivision.description: An area of land which is a sub-division within a country, such as a state, a county, a canton, a province, etc.

CurConversion.description: The result of converting one currency into another currency. E.g. local currency to USD, air miles to monetary.

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

FiledAmount.description: Internal tax filed amount as determined by the airline.

FiledTaxCode.description: Internal tax filed type code as determined by the airline.

QualifierCode.description: Used to specify if current, paid, additional taxes   Refer to IATA PADIS Code list data element 5305.

RefundInd.description: When true, this tax is refundable.

TaxCode.description: IATA TTBS Tax Code. Example: AY, GB

TaxTypeCode.description: Tax type code (e.g. Applied or Exempt).

BaggageAllowance.description: The amount of checked or carry-on luggage the airline will allow per passenger.

BookingAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

BookingRef.description: Information related to a booking or reservation.

BookletQty.description: Number of booklets issued for a given ticket/ document set.

CarrierFee.description: Carrier imposed fee detail, typically related to booking, ticketing, or servicing.

Commission.description: An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.

EndorsementText.description: Endorsement and restriction information applied for this set of ticket / document information.

FareDetail.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

OriginDest.description: The Origin and Destination airport/city pair which confines a passenger journey or an aircraft flight.

OriginalIssueInfo.description: The issuing carrier and issuing location of a ticket.

PaymentInfo.description: Information related to the settlement of a transaction through monetary or other compensations. For example, a payment may be applied to an entire Order or individual Order Items.

Penalty.description: Information related to a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.

PricingCountryCode.description: The country code used to identify the country in which the booked itinerary was priced.

PricingDate.description: Booked Itinerary Pricing Date. Example: 2017-01-13 Note: This is the date the booked itinerary was priced.

ServicingAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

Ticket.description: The accountable document issued by or on behalf of a carrier which includes notices and the flight and passenger coupons contained therein.

TicketRefIdentification.description: Additional, identifying information used to identify a ticket.

IATALocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

IssueDate.description: The date that the document was originally issued.

IssuingAgencyID.description: Unique Agency Seller ID. Example: CTRV

IssuingAirlineDesigCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

IssuingCarrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

TicketNumber.description: The document number comprised of the airline code, form code, and serial number.

RefTypeCode.description: Type code of the reservation control system/reference.  PADIS 9893.

ConnectedDocNumber.description: The ticket/ document number to which this document is connected.

Coupon.description: The portion of the Passenger Ticket and Baggage Check or Excess Baggage Ticket that indicates particular places between which the coupon is good for carriage.

ExchReissueInd.description: When TRUE, the specified ticket/document number is on behalf of a document which has been exchanged or reissued.

FeeOwnerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

PresentCreditCardInd.description: When TRUE, the credit/debit card used for purchase must be presented.

PrimaryDocInd.description: When TRUE, this is the primary ticket/document number.

RemarkText.description: Free text to provide further information related to the document.

ReportingTypeCode.description: For billing and settlement purposes, each time a travel agent requests an airline to perform an action on a document (Issuance, Refund, Exchange), he needs to know how to reconcile this action (via BSP, ARC, directly by ORA, etc.).

RoutingCode.description: For EMD-A and EMD-S tickets with routing.  Use 'D' if all board and off points are within the same country and 'I' if all board and of points are not within the same country.  For EMD-S with no routing, do not use.

TaxOnEMDInd.description: When TRUE, a tax has been collected and is due to a local government from the validating carrier.

TicketDocTypeCode.description: Document type code as defined by PADIS 1001 (Document/ Message Name, coded).

TicketNumber.description: The document number comprised of the airline code, form code, and serial number.

AircraftScheduledDateTime.description: The Scheduled Date and Time of Departure of the aircraft at the terminal or departure gate at an airport.

BoardingGateID.description: Identifier of the gate. E.g. A5

IATALocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

StationName.description: Name of the station. E.g. George Bush Intercontinental Airport

AircraftScheduledDateTime.description: The Scheduled Date and Time of Departure of the aircraft at the terminal or departure gate at an airport.

BoardingGateID.description: Identifier of the gate. E.g. A5

HintText.description: Media object tip which is typically used in a client GUI (a mouseover tip). Example: Envoy Class Seat

MediaID.description: Uniquely Identifies a Media file within the context of one message.

RenderingInstructionsText.description: Rendering Instruction Parameters. Notes: This is typically used for XSLT.

RenderingMethodText.description: Rendering Method name.  E.g. Narrative, XSLT, etc.

RenderingOutputFormatText.description: An identifier for a file format or content type of the rendered output.

RenderingOverviewText.description: An overview of the rendering method or style.

WidthMeasure.description: Media (typically Image) width in specified units.

Carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

Country.description: A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

MerchantID.description: identifier passed from the merchant (airline) to the PSP/Bank to identify themselves during the authorization transaction.

MerchantName.description: name under which the merchant is registered within their PSP/Bank

OfferItemRefID.description: Reference to the OfferItemID of the selected OfferItem (contained in either a standard Offer or an a-la-carte Offer) returned in a previous shopping response.

OfferRefID.description: Reference to the OfferID of the selected Offer (either a standard Offer or an a-la-carte Offer) returned in a previous shopping response.

OwnerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

ResponseRefID.description: Reference to unique shopping session response ID, as provided in the airline's previous shopping response.

PriceGuaranteeTimeLimitDateTime.description: The date beyond which a price is no longer guaranteed. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

TicketingTimeLimitDateTime.description: The time by which passengers must secure tickets (or other accountable documents) for confirmed reservation as agreed with the airline.  Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

BaggageItem.description: Baggage service information used for long sells.

FlightItem.description: Flight service information used for long sells.

OtherItem.description: Other service information used for long sells.

SeatItem.description: Seat service information used for long sells.

MaximumQty.description: The MAXIMUM Quantity of the Option that may be ordered. Example: 4

MinimumQty.description: The MINIMUM Quantity of the Option that may be ordered. Example: 2

OriginDest.description: The Origin and Destination airport/city pair which confines a passenger journey or an aircraft flight.

DestCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

OriginCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

OriginDestID.description: Uniquely identifies an Origin Destination within the context of one message.

PaxJourneyRefID.description: Reference to the journeys for which this Offer Item can be provided.

LabelText.description: Used to differentiate multiple Postal Addresses of one contact.  Examples: AddressAtOrigin or AddressAtDestination

OtherAddressText.description: Other Contact Method Value. Example: www.marketingsite.com

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

Price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

AgentDutyText.description: Internally defined agent authority to request changes.

City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address, or metropolitan area)

Country.description: A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

Device.description: Device upon which the secure transaction will occur.

RequestTime.description: Point of sale timestamp value.  Example: 2017-01-13T13:59:38Z  Note: This may be used if the point of sale time zone differs from the message creation timestamp.

Aggregator.description: An entity who distributes a Seller's shopping request to multiple Airlines and aggregates subsequent responses.

Corporation.description: A company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law.

MarketingCarrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

ORA.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

POA.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

RetailPartner.description: A company that partners with a manufacturer or producer to market and sell the manufacturer's products, services, or technologies.

TravelAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

Participant.description: Information related to parties relevant to the contents of this message.

Recipient.description: Information related to the party receiving this message.

Sender.description: Information related to the party sending this message.

IntendedPaxQty.description: Intended number of passengers for this Group.

PaxJourney.description: A collection of segments which satisfies transportation of a passenger for a given origin and destination.

DistanceMeasure.description: Total distance between the beginning and end stations of a leg, measured by the great circle of the earth.

Duration.description: Total segment time including the combined air time and connection times of any legs.

InterlineSettlementInfo.description: Information related to the value of a product or service as it pertains to interline transactions.

PaxJourneyID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Journey within the context of one message.

PaxSegmentRefID.description: References a Passenger Segment ID within this message.

Pax.description: Any person except members of the crew carried or to be carried with the consent of the carrier, on board of any transport vehicle such as aircraft, train, bus, ship. Holds the attributes specific to a one booking, from shopping to f

PaxSegment.description: Transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment.

ARNKInd.description: When TRUE, indicates an ARNK (ARrival uNKown) condition, i.e. a gap between current segment departure and previous segment arrival location, implying an unknown passenger movement.

Arrival.description: The action or process of arriving of a transport vehicle in any place or location.

CabinType.description: Type of compartment of an aircraft, offering specific services (e.g. business class, economy).

DatedOperatingLeg.description: The nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

Dep.description: The action or process of leaving of a transport vehicle from any place or location.

Duration.description: Total segment time including the combined air time and connection times of any legs.

InterlineSettlementInfo.description: Information related to the value of a product or service as it pertains to interline transactions.

MarketingCarrierInfo.description: The commercial designation under which a Dated Operating Segment can be booked, either under the operating carrier's designator or that of another carrier (codeshare).

MarketingCarrierRBD.description: Reservation Booking Designator.  A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. Identified using a single alpha character. E.g. 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Disc

OperatingCarrierInfo.description: An operation between board point and any subsequent off point within the same flight designator. Could be one or more legs. Could also be used for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

OperatingCarrierRBD.description: Reservation Booking Designator.  A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. Identified using a single alpha character. E.g. 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Disc

PaxSegmentID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Segment within the context of one message.

SecureFlightInd.description: When TRUE, this segment is subject to US TSA 'Secure Flight' passenger prescreening program.

SegmentTypeCode.description: Defines the operational flight segment type (e.g. Open, Passive, Service).  Encoding Scheme: IATA PADIS 1.4 Codeset FST - Flight Segment Type

TicketlessInd.description: When TRUE, there are no ticket records, as defined by IATA Resolutions, expected to be issued for this segment.

AgeMeasure.description: The Age of the Passenger.  To be used in NDC Anonymous Shopping requests or when the birthdate (in Individual) is not known.

Birthdate.description: The Date of Birth of the Passenger.  Intended to be used in NDC Anonymous Shopping requests. Example: 2017-01-13

CitizenshipCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

FOID.description: Form of identification.  Typically used to identify that the passenger is who he says he is.  This is the type of FOID as defined in AIRIMP (FF Number, Credit Card Number, etc.).

IdentityDoc.description: Any document which may be used to identify a person or verify aspects of a person's personal identity. If issued in a small, standard credit card size form, it is usually called an identity card. Some countries issue formal identity documents, while othe

Individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

LoyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

PTC.description: Type code applying to the Passenger which typically drives pricing (e.g. ADT, CHD, etc).

PaxID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

PaxRefID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

ProfileConsentInd.description: When TRUE, passenger authorizes the airline to share his/her profile information or send promotional emails.

RedressCase.description: A person's case of being registered with a country's redress program, which can eliminate watch list misidentification and assist in identity verification.

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

ResidenceCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

Individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

PaymentCard.description: A device that enables its owner (the cardholder) to make a payment by electronic funds transfer.

AddressVerificationInvalidInd.description: When true, the specified address was invalid.

AddressVerificationNoMatchInd.description: When true, the specified address could not be matched with issuing bank address on record.

AddressVerificationStatusCode.description: The address verification response code (AVS) when the ticketing agency performs address verification. Examples: X - Match: Street address and 9-digit ZIP code both match Y - Match: Street address and 5-digit ZIP code both match A - Partial Match: Str

CardBrandCode.description: A two-letter code assigned according to IATA Resolution 728. Example: VI for Visa

CardProductTypeCode.description: Used to specify whether the card is a Consumer (personal) or Commercial (corporate) card.

CardSecurityCode.description: 3-digit number printed on the signature panel on the back of the card and following the last four digits of the Primary Account Number (PAN). For American Express,  4 digits located on the front of the card, above the card number on the right hand side. Visa - CVV2, MasterCard - CVC2, American Express - CID, Discover - CMID, Union Pay - CVN2, JCB - CAV2.

SecureProgram.description: Contains enrolment information of the Payment Card.  e.g. Verified by Visa.

ServiceDefinitionRefID.description: References a Service Definition ID within this message.

BaggageAllowanceRefID.description: Reference to a Baggage Allowance ID within this message.

SeatProfileRefID.description: Reference to a Seat Profile ID within this message.

ServiceBundle.description: Where several services are offered for sale as one service.

ServiceDefinition.description: Description and characteristics of a non-flight product or service that can be separately sold and delivered. E.g. bag, seat, meal on a flight.

BilateralTimeLimit.description: A bilaterally agreed limitation or restriction of time.

BookingInstructions.description: Optional service booking instructions to include SSR, OSI and upgrade Method.

DepositTimeLimitDateTime.description: The date by which a deposit must be paid for an order Examples:  2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

NamingTimeLimitDateTime.description: The time by which an Order must be completed with individual passenger names. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

OwnerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

PaymentTimeLimitDateTime.description: The date by which a payment must be made for the confirmed items in the order. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

PriceGuaranteeTimeLimitDateTime.description: The date beyond which a price is no longer guaranteed. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

RFIC.description: Reason For Issuance Code  Examples: A (Air Transportation) C (Baggage) E (Airport Services) F (Merchandise) G (In-flight Services)

RFISC.description: Reason For Issuance Sub Code. Examples: 0CC (First Checked Bag) 0B1 (In-flight Entertainment) 0BX (Lounge)

ServiceCode.description: Airline specific service code which can be associated with the Reason for Issuance Sub Code.  Sample implementer encoding: XLEG for Extra Leg Room Seat XBAG for Extra Bag

ServiceDefinitionAssociation.description: Choice to determine if the information of this ServiceDefinition needs to be extended with specific Bag or Seat characteristics, or whether the ServiceDefinition is used as a bundle of further ServiceDefinitions.

ServiceDefinitionID.description: Uniquely Identifies a Service Definition within the context of one message.

ServiceDetails.description: Detailed Service information, including Service Coupon and Service Quantity Rules.

TicketingTimeLimitDateTime.description: The time by which passengers must secure tickets (or other accountable documents) for confirmed reservation as agreed with the airline.  Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

ValidatingCarrierCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

CouponTypeCode.description: Contains instruction on what type of traffic document should be issued for an optional service. Examples: EMD Associated EMD Standalone No EMD Electronic Ticket

FeeBasisCode.description: Service fee basis. Examples: DIS (Option directly applied to fare) FEE (Baggage only) FNA (Item is not available/ applicable) INC (Item is free of charge) NAP (Item not applicable/ available) SUR (Surcharge) Encoding Scheme: IATA Padis Codeset - List for data element SFB - Service Fee Basis

InstantPurchaseCode.description: Instant purchase type. Examples: CC (Ticketless purchase immediately charged to credit card) NO (Not an instant purchase) TT (Simultaneous with time of ticketing) Encoding scheme: IATA PADIS Codeset IPT - Instant Purchase Type

MaxQty.description: The MAXIMUM Quantity of the Service Item that may be ordered. Example: 4

MinQty.description: The MINIMUM Quantity of the Service Item that may be ordered. Example: 2

AddlDataMeasure.description: Provides additional supporting measurement information in case the Special Service requires it.

Qty.description: A quantity is a counted number of non-monetary units, possibly including fractions.

SpecialServiceCode.description: Code that identifies the special service.

IATALocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

StationName.description: Name of the station. E.g. George Bush Intercontinental Airport

AllRefundableInd.description: When true, all tax breakdown amounts are refundable.

Breakdown.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

AllRefundableInd.description: When true, all tax breakdown amounts are refundable.

ApproximateInd.description: When true, this tax amount is approximate.

CollectionInd.description: When true, this tax must be collected.

Tax.description: A compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits or added to the cost of some goods, services, and transactions.

TotalTaxAmount.description: Total of all applicable tax amounts included in the price.  If tax breakdowns are provided, this amount should match the sum of the tax breakdown amounts.

AddlFiledTaxCode.description: A qualifier to the Tax Code to distinguish taxes/fees/charges with the same tax code but with different business uses.

AddlTaxCode.description: A qualifier to the Tax Code to distinguish taxes/fees/charges with the same tax code but with different business uses.

AppTypeCode.description: Indicates at which point the tax was applied (e.g. S - Sale, D - Departure, A - Arrival, X - Delivery).

ApproximateInd.description: When true, this tax amount is approximate.

CollectionInd.description: When true, this tax must be collected.

CollectionPointTax.description: Tax data breakdown by collection point for XF(Passenger Facility Fee) and ZP(federal tax segment) taxes.

Country.description: A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

CountrySubDivision.description: An area of land which is a sub-division within a country, such as a state, a county, a canton, a province, etc.

CurConversion.description: The result of converting one currency into another currency. E.g. local currency to USD, air miles to monetary.

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

FiledAmount.description: Internal tax filed amount as determined by the airline.

FiledTaxCode.description: Internal tax filed type code as determined by the airline.

QualifierCode.description: Used to specify if current, paid, additional taxes   Refer to IATA PADIS Code list data element 5305.

RefundInd.description: When true, this tax is refundable.

TaxCode.description: IATA TTBS Tax Code. Example: AY, GB

TaxTypeCode.description: Tax type code (e.g. Applied or Exempt).

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

Term.description: Condition under which an agreement is reached.

TypeCode.description: Agency/ Agent Identification Type. Example: B - Booking Agent

RegistrationNumber.description: The complete alphanumeric identification assigned by the appropriate licensing authority to an individual aircraft.  Examples: ZZ123, N46573, OMGLAT    THIS SHOULD INCLUDE THE DASH!!!   The A

CarrierDesigCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

Multiple Offers can be requested at the same time, each of which could originate from different shopping responses (each with their own ResponseIDs). Each Offer selected could reference (via the OfferID) either standard Offers from an AirShoppingRS message (potentially with Flight-related services) or A-La-Carte Offers (containing optional ancillary services). These standard Offers and  A-La-Carte Offers would need to be consistent with the applicability rules defined by their relations (passengers or segments eligible for the enclosed OfferItems) and would be combined to produce a single Order, returned by the OrderViewRS message.

FareRule.description: Special purchasing rules and restrictions used to differentiate fare levels from one another.

FareTypeCode.description: Fare Amount Type Code, ex: ADC (Additional Charge), IT (Tour Inclusive), NOADC (No additional charge).

PaxSegmentRefID.description: References a Passenger Segment ID within this message.

Price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

AccountCode.description: Corporate ID used for pricing special fares.  Example: 675124

StatisticalCodeText.description: Code used for domestic or international sales differentiation.

FareCode.description: Fare Type Code. Examples: 70J, Published Fares 70K, Dynamic Discounted Fares 749, Negotiated Fares 756, One Way Fare 758, Private Fares  Encoding Scheme: PADIS codeset element 9910 - Fare Qualifier

FareDetail.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

FareGroupID.description: Unique identifier for this Fare Group.

FarePriceTypeCode.description: Indicates if the fare price provided is a filed amount, net amount, or a sell amount.

BirthplaceText.description: Country Code where the Passenger was born (ISO 3166).  For example: DE

Individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

PaxID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

PaxRefID.description: Reference to a Passenger ID.

ProfileConsentInd.description: When TRUE, passenger authorizes the airline to share his/her profile information or send promotional emails.

Remark.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

ResidenceCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

Individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

PaymentCard.description: A device that enables its owner (the cardholder) to make a payment by electronic funds transfer.

Visa - CVV2, MasterCard - CVC2, American Express - CID, Discover - CMID, Union Pay - CVN2, JCB - CAV2.

ProtectedCardID.description: Payment card number protected in a non format preserving fashion.

SecurePayerAuthentication.description: Contains the indicators and fields that convey the result of the 3D Secure authentication transaction.  Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 1.0.

SecurePayerAuthenticationInstructions.description: Data returned from the Directory Server/ACS containing the PAReq and the ACS URL that enable to cardholder to authenticate.  Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 1.0.

SecureProgram.description: Contains enrolment information of the Payment Card.  e.g. Verified by Visa.

SellerOwnCardInd.description: When TRUE, indicates the seller is using their own card.  If FALSE, customer card is being used.

Desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

Merchant.description: A person or company that sells goods or services.

OrderItemRefID.description: Reference to an Order Item ID within this message.

OrderRefID.description: Reference to an Order ID for this payment.

Payer.description: Provides Payment Card details and commits the payment for the Offer(s) they wish to purchase. The Payment can take place either before or after the Order has been created.

PaymentInfoID.description: Uniquely identifies payment information within a message.

PaymentInfoRefID.description: Reference to a Payment Info ID.

PaymentCard.description: A device that enables its owner (the cardholder) to make a payment by electronic funds transfer.

Voucher.description: A document that entitles the holder to a discount or that may be exchanged for goods or services.

SettlementCurCode.description: Settlement Payment Currency code. Example: CHF

TrxID.description: Globally unique ID for a transaction processing instance.

DescText.description: Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

PenaltyAmount.description: Penalty monetary value amount and currency code.

ServiceDefinitionRefID.description: References a Service Definition ID within this message.

ServiceDefinitionRefID.description: References a Service Definition ID within this message.

BilateralTimeLimit.description: A bilaterally agreed limitation or restriction of time.

BookingInstructions.description: Optional service booking instructions to include SSR, OSI and upgrade Method.

FeeBasisCode.description: Service fee basis. Examples: DIS (Option directly applied to fare) FEE (Baggage only) FNA (Item is not available/ applicable) INC (Item is free of charge) NAP (Item not applicable/ available) SUR (Surcharge) Encoding Scheme: IATA Padis Codeset - List for data element SFB - Service Fee Basis

MaxQty.description: The MAXIMUM Quantity of the Service Item that may be ordered. Example: 4

MinQty.description: The MINIMUM Quantity of the Service Item that may be ordered.Example: 2

BookingStatusCode.description: Indicates the current status of a Service booking.

DeliveryCode.description: Grouping of services on delivery aspects

DeliveryStatusCode.description: Indicates the current status of a Service delivery

InterlineSettlementInfo.description: Information related to the value of a product or service as it pertains to interline transactions.

PaxRefID.description: Reference to a Passenger ID.

ServiceID.description: Service ID assigned by the carrier.
